text.section: The provisions of this section apply only in Somerset County.
The Liquor Licensing Board may issue a special Maryland Wine Festival (MWF) license.
An applicant for a special MWF license shall be a holder of a special temporary alcoholic beverages license, State Class 3 winery license, or State Class 4 winery license.
A special MWF licensee shall only display and sell wine that is produced and processed in Maryland.
A special MWF license entitles the holder to display and sell at retail wine for consumption on or off the licensed premises on the days and for the hours designated for the Maryland Wine Festival.
The provisions of this section do not prohibit the licensee from holding another alcoholic beverages license of a different class or nature.

The Liquor Licensing Board:
May select one weekend annually during the month of May or June for the Maryland Wine Festival; and
Shall choose a location for this festival.
The Liquor Licensing Board shall adopt regulations for implementing this section.
